conclusion: Determine if accelerations of objects A and B increase then decrease from 0 to t1 by analyzing v-t graph slopes.
Graph shows velocity on y-axis and time on x-axis; curves represent velocities of objects A and B.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time; represented by slope on v-t graph.
Slope of tangent line at any point on curve indicates acceleration at that point.
If slope is increasing, acceleration is increasing; if slope is decreasing, acceleration is decreasing.
For both objects A and B, direction of slope changes over time; initially positive, then decreases towards t1.
Tangent lines at different points on curves illustrate slope (acceleration) increases initially then decreases.
Slopes of curves for both objects first increase then decrease, indicating acceleration first increases then decreases.
Final answer: Yes, accelerations of both objects first increase then decrease during time interval from 0 to t1.
